segments.text: I notice the joyful chaos of the kitchen, with the kids so eager for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is almost tiptoeing on that stool, reaching for the open jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a pang of fear; he’s going to fall!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His determination is both amusing and alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the woman just carries on, blissfully unaware of the water cascading from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how she doesn’t seem to notice the growing puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful with her hand out, waiting for her turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of dread imagining what might happen if that stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The tidy garden outside seems to mock the chaos unfolding in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the cookies calling to the children, pulling them into their mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
